div.pre: 1942 Calabria, c. 1950 or earlier Burial: 4th cent. B.C. (K) Contents: c. 1000 AR Taras: didr.; dr. ("a large number, di- verse") diob. (Athena hd./Heracles and lion) ob. (cantharus/cantharus) 3/4-ob. (horse hd./horse hd.) 3/8-ob. (2 crescents/2 crescents) litrae; hemilitrae (shell/dolphin) Disposition: dispersed A note in the ANS states that there were "literally hundreds of varieties of these small pieces with varying symbols and letters, many unlisted in the Vlasto catalogue"
